attributes.action: Immediate ban on driver who drives over the speed limits
attributes.background:
Any driver who drives their car over the speed limit on any road must get an  immediate ban - warning should not be given 
Public safety is first no matter also we want the council and police to install more speed cameras on 20 speed limit roads.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions which call for actions that are the responsibility of the UK Government or Parliament. Installation of speed cameras on residential roads is a matter for local highways authorities, usually local councils.

You could raise the issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find your local councillors here:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You could start a new petition which calls for a clear action that is the responsibility of the UK Government or Parliament. For example, a petition which calls for reform of the speeding penalties system so that all drivers found guilty of speeding receive a ban from driving. You can find out more about the current speeding penalties system here:

https://www.gov.uk/speeding-penalties
